00016 // Brief This initialize the PobProto
00017 void InitPobProto (void)
00018 {
00019         PobProto        Proto; // struct to set the pob-proto
00020         
00021         Proto.porta=ALL_PORTA_AS_ANA;   //to get the position of the analogic joystick, you have to set the PORTA as analogic input
00022         Proto.portc=RC7_AS_DO| RC6_AS_DO |RC3_AS_DO |RC2_AS_SERVO|RC1_AS_SERVO |RC0_AS_SERVO;   //all pin of PORTC are configured to manage servomotors
00023         Proto.portd=RD7_AS_DI   | RD6_AS_DI     |RD5_AS_DI |RD4_AS_DI|RD3_AS_DO |RD2_AS_DO      |RD1_AS_DO      |RD0_AS_DO;             //RD0 RD1 RD2 RD3 are configured as digitals output to gear DC motor, RD4 RD5 RD6 RD7 are configured as digitals input
00024         SetPobProto(&Proto);    //set the pob proto
00025 }

00032 // Set the bitmap  picture of the first 127 ASCII Char in ASCII_GRAPHIC_BUFFER
00033 // ASCII_GRAPHIC_BUFFER will be used to get the pictures of characters to display on the LCD
00034 
00035 void InitAsciiBuffer() 
00036 {
00037         GraphicBuffer ASCII_GRAPHIC_BUFFER;
00038         
00039         InitGraphicBuffer(&ASCII_GRAPHIC_BUFFER,LCD_WIDTH,LCD_HEIGHT,ONE_BIT,ASCII_Buffer); 
00040         ClearGraphicBuffer(&ASCII_GRAPHIC_BUFFER);
00041         DrawBitmap(0,0, IDB_ASCII,bitmap,&ASCII_GRAPHIC_BUFFER); //bitmap is an array built by pob-tools
00042 }

00044 /****************************************************************************************************************************
00045 * PrintTextOnPobLCD : displays a string in the screen buffer
00046 *
00047 * row : LCD display Row of the first char
00048 * col :  LCD display column of the first char
00049 * string : string to display, Use 'sprintf' function to build a string including floats and intergers
00050 * Screen_Bufffer : Screen buffer to display
00051 *
00052 * ASCII_Buffer is the buffer oh the fisrt 127 chars of the ASCII table. Each char is 8x8 pixels, it is possible to display 16 char per row and 8 columns
00053 *****************************************************************************************************************************/
00054 
00055 void PrintTextOnPobLCD(int row, int col, char *string, UInt8 *Screen_Buffer)
00056 {
00057         int i,j,k=0; // i = ascii char starting buffer; j = 0 to 7 (8 times 8 points)
00058 
00059 while(*string) 
00060         {
00061                 // starting point in the ASCII_Buffer of the char to display,128 (16charx8lines of pixels) is a complete row of text
00062                 i = (string[0]/16)*128 + (string[0]%16);        
00063         // display char on Screen_Buffer, 8 bytes
00064         for (j=0; j<8; j++) 
00065                 {               
00066                 // 8 intergers to define a bitmap of a char
00067                 Screen_Buffer[col+row*128+k*16]=ASCII_Buffer[i+j*16];
00068                 k++;
00069                 }
00070         string++;       
00071         k=0;
00072         // 1 byte right
00073         col+=1;                                         
00074         if (col%16==0) 
00075                 {                       
00076                 // Manages end of line and go to the next line on the left
00077                 row++; 
00078                 col=0;
00079                         // Go to the top of the screen if the bottom is reached
00080                         if (row%8 == 0)         row=0;  
00081                 }
00082         }
00083 }
